oai_dc:dc.dc:title: J. G. Decker letter to parents from Camp Shiloh
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter written in German from John G. Decker to his parents. He tells them about a recent illness and a brief action against Confederate soldiers that resulted in the capture of 150-200 enemy men. The stationery features a "Union Forever" embossment. See also the John G. Decker Papers, Mf. 1964.
